Dataset: Global distribution data for cattle, buffaloes, horses, sheep, goats, pigs, chickens and ducks in 2010
Variables: livestock abundance: chicken, cattle
Citation: Gilbert, M., Nicolas, G., Cinardi, G., Van Boeckel, T.P., Vanwambeke, S.O., Wint, G.R.W., Robinson, T.P., 2018. Global distribution data for cattle, buffaloes, horses, sheep, goats, pigs, chickens and ducks in 2010. Sci Data 5, 180227. https://doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2018.227
Derivation: digital curation of multiple sources, Random forest classification

Variables: harvested, yeild, physical, production by irrigation method across 42 different crops
Citation: International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI), 2024. Global Spatially-Disaggregated Crop Production Statistics Data for 2020 Version 1.0. https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/SWPENT
Notes: reference data set for agriculture land use and crop production, yield, surface covered
Derivation: from reported data, distribute values by crop type and cultivation type across geographies using cross entroppy methods
Inputs: GlobCover 2005, MODIS v.5, AFRICOVER, GLC-2000, ISCGM, CORINE, and a number of national maps, FAO/IIASA, IFPRI, MIRCA

Dataset: Global Gridded Agricultural Gross Domestic Product (AgGDP)
Variables: Layer of modelled GDP from coarse agriculture : livestock, crops, fishing, forestry
Citation: Ru, Y., Blankespoor, B., Wood-Sichra, U., Thomas, T.S., You, L., Kalvelagen, E., 2023. Estimating local agricultural gross domestic product (AgGDP) across the world. Earth System Science Data 15, 1357–1387. https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-15-1357-2023
Exceptions: a small number of regions are missing

Variables: wide range of variables related to the level of economic and human development, see https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/search/dataset/0037712
Citation: data layer specific

Dataset: A global-scale data set of mining areas
Variables: mines location
Citation: Maus, V., Giljum, S., Gutschlhofer, J., Da Silva, D.M., Probst, M., Gass, S.L.B., Luckeneder, S., Lieber, M., McCallum, I., 2020. A global-scale data set of mining areas. Sci Data 7, 289. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-020-00624-w
Derivation: from satellite imagery and image processing

Dataset: Global mining footprint mapped from high-resolution satellite imagery
Variables: mines location
Citation: Tang, L., Werner, T.T., 2023. Global mining footprint mapped from high-resolution satellite imagery. Commun Earth Environ 4, 134. https://doi.org/10.1038/s43247-023-00805-6
Derivation: from high res satellite imagery and manual validation

Dataset: Global database of cement  production assets and upstream  suppliers
Variables: exact location, owner information, plant_type, production_type, capacity
Citation: Tkachenko, N., Tang, K., McCarten, M., Reece, S., Kampmann, D., Hickey, C., Bayaraa, M., Foster, P., Layman, C., Rossi, C., Scott, K., Yoken, D., Christiaen, C., Caldecott, B., 2023. Global database of cement production assets and upstream suppliers. Sci Data 10, 696. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-023-02599-w

Variables: Crude steel, iron capacity, steelmaking process, owner, location
Citation: Global Steel Plant Tracker, Global Energy Monitor, April 2024 (V1) release.

Variables: location of power lines
Citation: Arderne, C., Zorn, C., Nicolas, C., Koks, E.E., 2020. Predictive mapping of the global power system using open data. Sci Data 7, 19. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-019-0347-4
Notes: modelling frmaework to predict location of power transmission infrastructre based on distribution of potential demand and existing generators
Derivation: The algorithm attempts to connect every location with the shortest possible distance, while following roads (preferring larger) where possible
Inputs: GHSL, OSM, NASA, NOAA, ESA, World Bank

Dataset: WRI Global Database of Power Plants
Variables: power plant location, type of fuel, estimated output capacity
Citation: Global Energy Observatory, Google, KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Enipedia, World Resources Institute. 2018. Global Power Plant Database. Published on Resource Watch and Google Earth Engine; http://resourcewatch.org/ https://earthengine.google.com/
Notes: one of the main references for power plant data sets
Exceptions: lower coverage in solar and wind

Variables: unit capacity, status, ownership, fuel type, start year, retirement date, geolocation, ...
Citation: Global Integrated Power Tracker, Global Energy Monitor, September 2024 release. Available at: https://globalenergymonitor.org/projects/global-integrated-power-tracker/
Notes: More comprehensive than the WRI dataset

Dataset: GIRI BEM Global Building Exposure Model
Variables: Built capital, total and non-/residential, ~5km grid
Citation:
Piller, T., Benvenuti, A., De Bono, A., 2023. The GIRI global building exposure model (BEM).
Available at: https://giri.unepgrid.ch/sites/default/files/2023-09/GIRI_BEM_report_UNIGE.pdf
[Accessed January 2024]

Variables: built capital (replacement cost) and number of buildings per admin region ( perhaps ~1000km² hex cell on request), residential, commercial and industrial
Citation: Yepes-Estrada, C., Calderon, A., Costa, C., Crowley, H., Dabbeek, J., Hoyos, M., Martins, L., Paul, N., Rao, A., Silva, V. (2023). Global Building Exposure Model for Earthquake Risk Assessment. Earthquake Spectra. doi:10.1177/87552930231194048

Variables: country and source level emissions for Agriculture, Buildings, Fluorinated gases, Fossil fuel operations, Forestry and Land Use, Manufacturing, Mineral Extraction, Power, Transportation, Waste sectors
Citation: Climate TRACE (2024), Climate TRACE Emissions Inventory v4, https://climatetrace.org
Notes: on request: Land use raster data for global forestry at 1km-by-1km distribution, Global synthetic fertilizer application raster data at 5km by 5km resolution, Rice cultivation geospatial data at 10m-by-10m resolution, Enteric fermentation and manure left on soils in cattle pastures raster data , vailable at a 10km-by-10km resolution, cropland fires raster data available at at 11km-by-11-km resolution, Onsite fuel usage in residential and non-residential buildings raster data available at a 1km-by-1km resolution, Emissions from individual ship voyages, Road transportation, emissions at a road-segment level

Variables: emissions of various gases and particulates, 0.1 degree grid
Citation: Janssens-Maenhout, G., Crippa, M., Guizzardi, D., Muntean, M., Schaaf, E., Dentener, F., Bergamaschi, P., Pagliari, V., Olivier, J. G. J., Peters, J. A. H. W., van Aardenne, J. A., Monni, S., Doering, U., Petrescu, A. M. R., Solazzo, E., and Oreggioni, G. D.: EDGAR v4.3.2 Global Atlas of the three major greenhouse gas emissions for the period 1970–2012, Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 11, 959–1002, doi:10.5194/essd-11-959-2019, 2019.
Notes: refer to their methodology and inputs to modelling: database built using spatial proxy datasets with the location of energy and manufacturing facilities, road networks, shipping routes, human and animal population density and agricultural land use

Dataset: DOSE – Global data set of reported  sub-national economic output
Variables: 3 sector breakdown of economic activity: agriculture , manufacturing, services;  GDP
Citation: Wenz, L., Carr, R.D., Kögel, N., Kotz, M., Kalkuhl, M., 2023. DOSE – Global data set of reported sub-national economic output. Sci Data 10, 425. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-023-02323-8
Derivation: aggregation of data from multiple sources
Inputs: OECD Regional Database, Eurostat, National DBs
Exceptions: central, northern,western africa, some of central  and eastern asia

Dataset: Gridded global datasets for Gross Domestic Product and Human Development Index over 1990–2015
Variables: HDI index, gdp, population
Citation: Kummu, M., Taka, M., Guillaume, J.H.A., 2018. Gridded global datasets for Gross Domestic Product and Human Development Index over 1990–2015. Sci Data 5, 180004. https://doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2018.4
Derivation: aggregation of data from multiple sources
Inputs: WB, CIA, HYDE 3.2, GHSL, EuroStat, UNDP

Dataset: Global 1?km?×?1?km gridded revised real gross domestic product and electricity consumption during 1992–2019 based on calibrated nighttime light data
Variables: GDP, electricty consumption
Citation: Chen, J., Gao, M., Cheng, S., Hou, W., Song, M., Liu, X., Liu, Y., 2022. Global 1 km × 1 km gridded revised real gross domestic product and electricity consumption during 1992–2019 based on calibrated nighttime light data. Sci Data 9, 202. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-022-01322-5
Derivation: based on the PSO-BP algorithm, we could confidently convert the scale of NPP/VIIRS data from 2013 to 2019 to the scales of DMSP/OLS data and obtain stable and continuous global 1?km?×?1?km gridded nighttime light data

Dataset: Global gridded GDP data set consistent with the shared socioeconomic pathways
Variables: GDP 2005, 2030-2100 under SSPs, ~1km
Citation: Wang, T., Sun, F. Global gridded GDP data set consistent with the shared socioeconomic pathways. Sci Data 9, 221 (2022). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-022-01300-x

Variables: GDP, asset value (produced capital)
Citation: Eberenz, S., Stocker, D., Röösli, T., and Bresch, D. N.: Asset exposure data for global physical risk assessment, Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 12, 817–833, https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-817-2020, 2020.

Variables: Beef abbatoirs, cement, iron and steel works, ethylene and chemical facilities, paper and pulp, wastewater treatment.
Citation: See databases for citations

Dataset: GLORIA - MRIO Global Resource Input-Output Assessment
Variables: 164 regions, 120 sectors  supply-use transactions, final y, value added v in 5 valuations (basic prices, trade margins, transport margins, taxes on products, subsidies on products) and a continuous time series for 1990-2027
Citation: Lenzen, M., Geschke, A., Abd Rahman, M.D., Xiao, Y., Fry, J., Reyes, R., Dietzenbacher, E., Inomata, S., Kanemoto, K., Los, B., Moran, D., Schulte In Den Bäumen, H., Tukker, A., Walmsley, T., Wiedmann, T., Wood, R., Yamano, N., 2017. The Global MRIO Lab – charting the world economy. Economic Systems Research 29, 158–186. https://doi.org/10.1080/09535314.2017.1301887
Derivation: assembly from a set of local and global sources of material trade flows

Dataset: ESA Land cover classification gridded maps from 1992 to present
Variables: land cover, yearly, 300m, 22 classes
Citation: European Space Agency Climate Change Initiative Land Cover project (2021) Land cover classification gridded maps from 1992 to present derived from satellite observations, v2.1.1. https://doi.org/10.24381/cds.006f2c9a

Variables: land cover, yearly, 100m, 2015-2019, discrete or continuous "fraction" maps
Citation: Copernicus Global Dynamic Land Cover. European Union's Copernicus Land Monitoring Service information. https://land.copernicus.eu/en/products/global-dynamic-land-cover. <DOI: dataset DOI, if applicable> (Accessed on DD.MM.YYYY)

Variables: Administrative boundaries, Water bodies, Topography, OSM, WorldClim, Nightlights, Land Cover, World Database of Protected Areas (WDPA), JRC Global Human Settlement Layer (GHSL), Global Urban Footprint (GUF)
Citation: Lloyd, C. T. et al. (2019) ‘Global spatio-temporally harmonised datasets for producing high-resolution gridded population distribution datasets’, Big Earth Data, 3(2), pp. 108–139. doi: 10.1080/20964471.2019.1625151

Variables: Population, built-up area, height, volume, settlement classification
Citation: Schiavina, M., Melchiorri, M., Pesaresi, M., Politis, P., Carneiro Freire, S.M., Maffenini, L., Florio, P., Ehrlich, D., Goch, K., Carioli, A., Uhl, J., Tommasi, P. and Kemper, T., GHSL Data Package 2023, Publications Office of the European Union, Luxembourg, 2023, ISBN 978-92-68-02341-9, doi:10.2760/098587, JRC133256.
Notes: Among best-available global population, built-area data. Non-/residential breakdown for built area/volume. Settlement type classification available according to non/res, density, urban/rural.
Derivation: multiple-quantization-minimal-support (MQMS) generalization of the symbolic machine learning (SML) approach (Pesaresi, Syrris, et al., 2016)
Inputs: Landsat, Sentinel-2 imagery +  Facebook, Microsoft, and Open Street Map (OSM),UN World Population Prospects

Variables: Population count, density, demographics

Dataset: BACI: International Trade Database at the Product-level
Variables: international trade by product
Citation: Gaulier, G., Zignago, S., 2010. BACI: International Trade Database at the Product-Level. The 1994-2007 Version (Working Papers No. 2010–23). CEPII. http://www.cepii.fr/CEPII/fr/publications/wp/abstract.asp?NoDoc=2726
Notes: best available curated version of UN comtrade data

Dataset: ITPD-S International Trade and Production Database for Simulation
Variables: international and domestic trade at the industry level covering agriculture, mining, energy, manufacturing, and services. 170 industries in all broad sectors of the economy in 265 countries for the years 1986-2019
Citation: Borchert, I., Larch, M., Shikher, S., and Yotov, Y. (2024), “Globalization, Trade, and Inequality: Evidence from a New Database." USITC Working Paper 2024–11–A.

Variables: road, rail locations
Citation: OpenStreetMap contributors. 2024.
